intro: Matelea herbacea, commonly known as the desert nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers, and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing a drought-resistant adaptation. Its leaves are usually small and hairy, while its fruit is a capsule containing numerous seeds. Matelea herbacea is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, blooming at night to attract specific pollinators.
